org.mcm.sws
Class ServiceExec2

java.lang.Object
  org.mcm.sws.ServiceExec2
public class ServiceExec2
extends java.lang.Object

This class handles the low level operations involved in calling web services. It reads the WSDL information (Binding, address, etc.) to correctly create an outgoing message; it parses requests and creates the results (i.e. materialized effects) in the factbase. The class can be used in context of planning (e.g. execution of plan, sensing sub-plans) but it can also be used directly for invokation of Web Services, i.e. as a high level web service execution facility.

Author:
Joachim Peer

parseMessage

public static java.util.List parseMessage(Formula formula,
                                          Element body,
                                          java.lang.String currentPath,
                                          java.util.Map varBindings,
                                          java.util.Map accumulatedBindings,
                                          OperationBinding opBinding,
                                          OpDef opDef)
goal: populate the variables of the effect condition (as defined in opDef) with the actual values from the SOAP message e.g. 12345 leads to (has-session-id site0232 12345) how to accomplish this: 1. get variable bindings (TODO: support FORALL) 2. create clone of postcondition (TODO: semantics of implications, etc? - no problems because not allowed in effects) 3. add data to factbase and: - check if the effect condition (if we have some) is fulfilled - check if an exception occurred

Parameters:
formula - Description of the Parameter
body - Description of the Parameter
currentPath - Description of the Parameter
varBindings - Description of the Parameter
opDef - Description of the Parameter
Returns:
Description of the Return Value
